item.title: CS135-lecture-20210315
item.description: Parse trees and Ambiguity # Parse trees are graphical representations of what each non-terminal produces during a derivation. An example of a parse tree: \( S \to AB \\ A \to aaA \mid \lambda \\ B \to bbB \mid b\) This grammar produces all strings that have an even number of \( a \) ’s and an odd number of \( b \) ’s.
